document.full_text: tobacco will kill nearly six million people this year, including 600,000 non-smokers, because governments are not doing enough to persuade people to quit or protect others from second-hand smoke, the world health organization (who) said on tuesday.
document.title: smoking could kill 8 million a year by 2030: who
lines_and_colors: tobacco will kill nearly six million people this year, including 600,000 non-smokers, because governments are not doing enough to persuade people to quit or protect others from second-hand smoke, the world health organization (who) said on tuesday.
